ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Like 'xtable', creates styled tables. Export to HTML, LaTeX, 'Word',  'Excel', 'PowerPoint' and RTF. Simple, modern interface to manipulate  borders, size, position, captions, colours, text styles and number formatting. Table cells can span multiple rows and/or columns. Includes  a 'huxreg' function for creation of regression tables, and 'quick_*'  one-liners to print data to a new document.

Like 'xtable', creates styled tables. Export to HTML, LaTeX, 'Word',  'Excel', 'PowerPoint' and RTF. Simple, modern interface to manipulate  borders, size, position, captions, colours, text styles and number formatting. Table cells can span multiple rows and/or columns. Includes  a 'huxreg' function for creation of regression tables, and 'quick_*'  one-liners to print data to a new document.

name: r-huxtable
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "5.8.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-huxtable
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/huxtable_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/huxtable/huxtable_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7c5ccca5debe9d5a9b11f802c9111d4a213aa53ccfb0515055482936557e522c

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-r6
    - r-assertthat
    - r-commonmark
    - r-fansi
    - r-generics
    - r-glue
    - r-htmltools
    - r-memoise
    - r-rlang
    - r-stringi
    - r-stringr >=1.2.0
    - r-tidyselect
    - r-xml2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-r6
    - r-assertthat
    - r-commonmark
    - r-fansi
    - r-generics
    - r-glue
    - r-htmltools
    - r-memoise
    - r-rlang
    - r-stringi
    - r-stringr >=1.2.0
    - r-tidyselect
    - r-xml2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('huxtable')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('huxtable')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://hughjonesd.github.io/huxtable
  license: MIT
  summary: Like 'xtable', creates styled tables. Export to HTML, LaTeX, 'Word',  'Excel', 'PowerPoint' and RTF. Simple, modern interface to manipulate  borders, size, position, captions, colours, text styles and number formatting. Table cells can span multiple rows and/or columns. Includes  a 'huxreg' function for creation
    of regression tables, and 'quick_*'  one-liners to print data to a new document.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Type: Package
# Package: huxtable
# Title: Easily Create and Style Tables for LaTeX, HTML and Other Formats
# Version: 4.6.1
# Authors@R:  person(given = "David", family = "Hugh-Jones", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "davidhughjones@gmail.com")
# Author: David Hugh-Jones [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: David Hugh-Jones <davidhughjones@gmail.com>
# Description: Like 'xtable', creates styled tables. Export to HTML, LaTeX, 'Word',  'Excel', 'PowerPoint' and RTF. Simple, modern interface to manipulate  borders, size, position, captions, colours, text styles and number formatting. Table cells can span multiple rows and/or columns. Includes  a 'huxreg' function for creation of regression tables, and 'quick_*'  one-liners to print data to a new document.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# URL: https://hughjonesd.github.io/huxtable
# BugReports: https://github.com/hughjonesd/huxtable/issues
# Imports: assertthat, generics, glue, memoise, rlang, stats, stringr (>= 1.2.0), tibble, tidyselect, utils
# Suggests: bookdown, broom (>= 0.5.1), broom.mixed, covr, crayon, devtools, dplyr, flextable, ggplot2, httr, knitr, lazyeval, lme4, lmtest, nlme, nnet, officer, openxlsx, psych, rmarkdown, sandwich, scales, testthat, tinytex
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-08-06 10:30:25 UTC; david
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-08-06 10:50:02 UTC
